MamaBeth

SandraDodd@... wrote:
In a message dated 1/19/2004 1:50:24 PM Mountain Standard Time,
kittiecatte@... writes:
-=-"And so" implies a cause-and-
effect or correlative relationship, does it not? Does this somehow
mean we can't be objective unless we agree or are the same?-=-
===========

We can't objectively discuss the cause and effect of media input if some of
the people in the discussion believe that Satan is waiting to take the form of
Cassie on Dragontales to lure children into sin.

Sandra

messages.subject: Neutral or Objective?
messages.msgSnippet: ... (probably few ... *** ummm, huh? Sorry, I don t get that?  I did try! And so implies a cause-and- effect or correlative relationship, does it not?  Does
messages.messageBody:
SandraDodd@a... wrote:
> Well then you have beliefs and situations others here might not
(probably few
> do) and so the discussion can't really be neutral or objective.
>


*** ummm, huh?
Sorry, I don't get that? I did try! "And so" implies a cause-and-
effect or correlative relationship, does it not? Does this somehow
mean we can't be objective unless we agree or are the same? (And
then, agree with what beliefs? Have what situations? How do we know
if we don't discuss it?) I am very lost on this. I don't want to be
posting things inappropriate to this list, either! Just trying to
learn the ropes...
Thanks
~Kit
